0.33.text:
Lower Slaughter is
a classic example

3.29.text:
of a Cotswold village,
with a babbling brook,

5.99.text:

14.70.text:

18.66.text:
As with many fairy-tale
regions in Europe,

22.54.text:
the present-day
beauty of the Cotswolds

25.08.text:
was the result
of an economic disaster.

26.91.text:
Wool was a huge industry
in medieval England.

29.66.text:
And Cotswold sheep
grew the very best.

34.66.text:
"In Europe,
the best wool is English.

36.66.text:
And in England,
the best wool is Cotswold."

39.25.text:
It's a story of boom and bust,
and then boom again.

43.69.text:
Because of its wool,
the region prospered.

46.99.text:
Wealthy wool merchants
built fine homes

52.37.text:
Thankful to God for the riches
their sheep brought,

55.20.text:
they built over-sized churches
nicknamed "wool cathedrals."

59.58.text:
But with the rise of cotton
and the Industrial Revolution,

66.70.text:
The fine Cotswold towns fell
into a depressed time warp,

73.50.text:
Because of that, the region
has a rustic charm.

75.99.text:
And that's the basis
of today's new prosperity.

79.66.text:
Its residents are catering
to lots of tourists,

83.62.text:
and the Cotswolds have become a
popular escape for Londoners --

86.50.text:
people who can afford
thatched mansions like these.

90.25.text:
In England, "Main Street"
is called "the high street" --

99.50.text:
designed to handle thousands
of sheep on market days.

102.12.text:
The handsome market
town of Chipping Campden

105.95.text:
has a high street that's changed
little over the centuries.

To make the weight
easier to bear,

130.91.text:
with its original stonework
from top to bottom intact,

136.79.text:
Hikers admire the surviving
medieval workmanship.

138.91.text:
You can imagine centuries
of wheelings and dealings

142.87.text:
that took place
under these very rafters.

150.24.text:
we come to the quaint
village of Stanton.

152.99.text:
Travel writers tend to
overuse the word "quaint."

156.66.text:
I save it for here
in the Cotswolds.

159.83.text:
A strict building code
keeps towns

162.91.text:
looking what many locals
call "overly quaint."

This church probably sits

175.04.text:

It's dedicated to Saint Michael.

178.58.text:
And Michael, the archangel
who fought the devil,

184.08.text:
Inside, you get a sense
that this church

186.99.text:
has comforted this community

193.66.text:
perhaps left over
